sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"使不安，使心烦意乱"之意。
means: upset ： 最普通，最通俗用词，侧重失去精神上的平静，心理上完全丧失平衡。
agitate ： 侧重指内心的焦虑，难于控制，表露于外。
disturb ： 指因某人的行动、扰乱、妨碍安静等而使人不得安宁。
perturb ： 书面语用词，指使人焦急烦恼，扰得心情不安。

sentence.Network_en: I hope I haven't said anything to upset you.
sentence.Network_cn: 但愿我没有说过让你不高兴的话。

sentence.Network_en: Argentina's erratic inflation rate threatens to upset the plans.
sentence.Network_cn: 阿根廷动荡不定的通货膨胀率可能会破坏那些计划。

sentence.Network_en: It's easy to get a tummy upset from river water.

entry.def: If you are upset, you are unhappy or disappointed because something unpleasant has happened to you.

example.ex: After she died I felt very, very upset...
example.tran: 她去世之后，我非常非常难过。
玛尔塔一副沮丧的模样。

entry.tran: 使心烦意乱；使生气；使心情不好
entry.def: If something upsets you, it makes you feel worried or unhappy.

example.ex: The whole incident had upset me and my fiancee terribly...
example.tran: 整个事件搞得我和未婚妻都心烦意乱。

example.ex: She warned me not to say anything to upset him...
example.tran: 她警告我不要说任何让他不高兴的话。

entry.def: If events upset something such as a procedure or a state of affairs, they cause it to go wrong.

example.ex: ...a deal that would upset the balance of power in the world's gold markets...
example.tran: 一桩将会打破全球黄金市场均势的交易

example.ex: House prices are easily upset by factors which have nothing to do with property.
example.tran: 房价很容易受到与房产毫不相干的因素的干扰。

entry.def: If you upset an object, you accidentally knock or push it over so that it scatters over a large area.

example.ex: Don't upset the piles of sheets under the box.
example.tran: 不要把箱子下面那几叠床单弄乱了。

example.ex: ...bumping into him, and almost upsetting the ginger ale.
example.tran: 撞上了他，差点打翻了姜味汽水

entry.def: A stomach upset is a slight illness in your stomach caused by an infection or by something that you have eaten.

example.ex: Paul was unwell last night with a stomach upset...
It wasn't anything serious. A mild stomach upset, that's all.
example.tran: 没什么大不了的。只是胃有点不舒服，没别的。

means.word_mean: 1. an unhappy and worried mental state;

sentences.sentence: "there was too much anger and disturbance"
"she didn't realize the upset she caused me"

means.word_mean: 2. the act of disturbing the mind or body;

sentences.sentence: "his carelessness could have caused an ecological upset"
"she was unprepared for this sudden overthrow of their normal way of living"

means.word_mean: 3. condition in which there is a disturbance of normal functioning;

sentences.sentence: "the doctor prescribed some medicine for the disorder"
"everyone gets stomach upsets from time to time"

means.word_mean: 4. a tool used to thicken or spread (the end of a bar or a rivet etc.) by forging or hammering or swaging
5. the act of upsetting something;

sentences.sentence: "he was badly bruised by the upset of his sled at a high speed"

means.word_mean: 6. an improbable and unexpected victory;

sentences.sentence: "the biggest upset since David beat Goliath"

means.word_mean: 1. disturb the balance or stability of;

sentences.sentence: "The hostile talks upset the peaceful relations between the two countries"

means.word_mean: 2. cause to lose one's composure
3. move deeply;
4. cause to overturn from an upright or normal position;

sentences.sentence: "The cat knocked over the flower vase"
"the clumsy customer turned over the vase"

means.word_mean: 5. form metals with a swage
6. defeat suddenly and unexpectedly;

sentences.sentence: "The foreign team upset the local team"

means.word_mean: 1. afflicted with or marked by anxious uneasiness or trouble or grief;

sentences.sentence: "one last worried check of the sleeping children"

means.word_mean: 2. thrown into a state of disarray or confusion;

sentences.sentence: "a confused mass of papers on the desk"

means.word_mean: 3. used of an unexpected defeat of a team favored to win;

sentences.sentence: "the Bills' upset victory over the Houston Oilers"

means.word_mean: 4. mildly physically distressed;
5. having been turned so that the bottom is no longer the bottom;

auth_sentence.res_content: He has been pretty upset by this at times.

auth_sentence.content: Others may become upset or dwell on the tragedy.
auth_sentence.res_content: Others may become upset or dwell on the tragedy.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Others may become upset or dwell on the tragedy.

auth_sentence.content: I was upset because it was a favourite skirt.
auth_sentence.res_content: I was upset because it was a favourite skirt.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I was upset because it was a favourite skirt.

Sentence.sentence: Facebook is a handy site, but I'm upset by the idea that my information is in the hands of people I don't That's too high a price to pay.
He is upset by its frequent rule changes
Facebook is a handy site, but I'm upset by the idea that my information is in the hands of people I don't That's too high a price to pay.
I think your boss would be very upset when he gets your letter of resignation.
Well, I don't think we do anything deliberately to upset our customers
I think your boss would be very upset when he gets your letter of resignation.

means.word_mean: 打翻, 弄翻
打乱, 扰乱
使苦恼, 使心烦; 使不适

sentences.cn: 他吃巧克力后感到胃不舒服。

means.word_mean: 翻倒, 扰乱, 不安, 不适
心烦的

sentences.en: He was upset at not being welcomed.
sentences.cn: 他因不受人欢迎而生气。

means.word_mean: 不舒服的

jushi.english: If you don't sit still, the boat will upset.
jushi.chinese: 如果你不坐好,小船会翻的。

jushi.english: The dish upset when you kicked.
jushi.chinese: 你踢了那个盘子,它翻了。

jushi.english: The boat upset and floated in the river.
jushi.chinese: 船翻了以后在江上漂浮。
